{{also|minute|minutė|minutë|minuté|minūte|minūtē}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|Minut|g=f|g2=n}} {{qual|obsolete}} ===Etymology=== 15th c., from {{der|de|ML.|minūta||60th of an hour; note}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/miˈnuːtə/}} * {{audio|de|De-Minute.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-Minute.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{rhymes|de|uːtə}} * {{hyphenation|de|Mi|nu|te}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|f||Minuten}} # [[minute]] {{gloss|unit of time; unit of angle}} #* '''1742'''. Adam Adolph Schöpfflein: ''Specimen trigonometriae ad fortificatoriam applicatae, oder trigonometrische Berechnung aller Linien und Winckel'', p.8: #*: Jeder Grad oder 360ste Theil des Circkels wird ferner vertheilt in 60. andere Theil, und heissen '''Minuten''', ein jedes '''Minut''' wieder in 60. Theil oder ''Secunda'', ein jedes Secund weiter in 60. Theil oder ''3tia'' [i.e. tertia] rc. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|n}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Gedenkminute}} * {{l|de|Gehminute}} * {{l|de|minutenlang}} * {{l|de|Schweigeminute}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|bor=1|cs|minuta}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Time]] [[Category:de:Units of measure]]
